verses.verse: The burden <WH4853> which Habakkuk <WH2265> the prophet <WH5030> did see <WH2372> <WH8804>.

O YY <WH3068>, how long shall I cry <WH7768> <WH8765>, and thou wilt not hear <WH8085> <WH8799> ! even cry out <WH2199> <WH8799> unto thee of violence <WH2555>, and thou wilt not save <WH3467> <WH8686> !

Why dost thou shew <WH7200> <WH8686> me iniquity <WH205>, and cause me to behold <WH5027> <WH8686> grievance <WH5999>? for spoiling <WH7701> and violence <WH2555> are before me: and there are that raise up <WH5375> <WH8799> strife <WH7379> and contention <WH4066>.

Therefore the Torah <WH8451> is slacked <WH6313> <WH8799>, and judgment <WH4941> doth never <WH5331> go forth <WH3318> <WH8799>: for the wicked <WH7563> doth compass <WH3803> <WH8688> about the righteous <WH6662>; therefore wrong <WH6127> <WH8794> judgment <WH4941> proceedeth <WH3318> <WH8799>.

Behold <WH7200> <WH8798> ye among the heathen <WH1471>, and regard <WH5027> <WH8685>, and wonder <WH8539> <WH8690> marvellously <WH8539> <WH8798>: for I will work <WH6466> <WH8802> a work <WH6467> in your days <WH3117>, which ye will not believe <WH539> <WH8686>, though it be told <WH5608> <WH8792> you.

For, lo, I raise up <WH6965> <WH8688> the Chaldeans <WH3778>, that bitter <WH4751> and hasty <WH4116> <WH8737> nation <WH1471>, which shall march <WH1980> <WH8802> through the breadth <WH4800> of the land <WH776>, to possess <WH3423> <WH8800> the dwellingplaces <WH4908> that are not theirs.
They are terrible <WH366> and dreadful <WH3372> <WH8737>: their judgment <WH4941> and their dignity <WH7613> shall proceed <WH3318> <WH8799> of themselves.

Their horses <WH5483> also are swifter <WH7043> <WH8804> than the leopards <WH5246>, and are more fierce <WH2300> <WH8804> than the evening <WH6153> wolves <WH2061>: and their horsemen <WH6571> shall spread <WH6335> <WH8804> themselves, and their horsemen <WH6571> shall come <WH935> <WH8799> from far <WH7350>; they shall fly <WH5774> <WH8799> as the eagle <WH5404> that hasteth <WH2363> <WH8804> to eat <WH398> <WH8800>.

They shall come <WH935> <WH8799> all for violence <WH2555>: their faces <WH6440> shall sup up <WH4041> as the east wind <WH6921>, and they shall gather <WH622> <WH8799> the captivity <WH7628> as the sand <WH2344>.

And they shall scoff <WH7046> <WH8691> at the kings <WH4428>, and the princes <WH7336> <WH8802> shall be a scorn <WH4890> unto them: they shall deride <WH7832> <WH8799> every strong hold <WH4013>; for they shall heap <WH6651> <WH8799> dust <WH6083>, and take <WH3920> <WH8799> it.
Then shall his mind <WH7307> change <WH2498> <WH8804>, and he shall pass over <WH5674> <WH8799>, and offend <WH816> <WH8804>, imputing this <WH2098> his power <WH3581> unto his god <WH433>.

Art thou not from everlasting <WH6924>, O YY <WH3068> my 'Elohim <WH430>, mine Holy One <WH6918>? we shall not die <WH4191> <WH8799>. O YY <WH3068>, thou hast ordained <WH7760> <WH8804> them for judgment <WH4941>; and, O mighty 'Elohim <WH6697>, thou hast established <WH3245> <WH8804> them for correction <WH3198> <WH8687>.

Thou art of purer <WH2889> eyes <WH5869> than to behold <WH7200> <WH8800> evil <WH7451>, and canst <WH3201> <WH8799> not look <WH5027> <WH8687> on iniquity <WH5999>: wherefore lookest <WH5027> <WH8686> thou upon them that deal treacherously <WH898> <WH8802>, and holdest thy tongue <WH2790> <WH8686> when the wicked <WH7563> devoureth <WH1104> <WH8763> the man that is more righteous <WH6662> than he?
And makest <WH6213> <WH8799> men <WH120> as the fishes <WH1709> of the sea <WH3220>, as the creeping things <WH7431>, that have no ruler <WH4910> <WH8802> over them?

They take up <WH5927> <WH8689> all of them with the angle <WH2443>, they catch <WH1641> <WH8799> them in their net <WH2764>, and gather <WH622> <WH8799> them in their drag <WH4365>: therefore they rejoice <WH8055> <WH8799> and are glad <WH1523> <WH8799>.

Therefore they sacrifice <WH2076> <WH8762> unto their net <WH2764>, and burn incense <WH6999> <WH8762> unto their drag <WH4365>; because by them <WH1992> their portion <WH2506> is fat <WH8082>, and their meat <WH3978> plenteous <WH1277>.
Shall they therefore empty <WH7324> <WH8686> their net <WH2764>, and not spare <WH2550> <WH8799> continually <WH8548> to slay <WH2026> <WH8800> the nations <WH1471> ?
